title: Presidential Waiver of Statutory Requirements Pursuant to Section 303 of the Defense Production Act of 1950, as Amended
summary: A Presidential Memorandum from February 13, 2026, waives statutory requirements under Section 303 of the Defense Production Act of 1950 to address shortfalls in critical Department of War supply chains that could severely impair national defense. This waiver applies to supply chains vital for reviving the defense industrial base, including those for aircraft, chemical/biological/radiological/nuclear threat protection, ground systems, nuclear warheads, radar and electronic warfare systems, shipbuilding, soldier systems, space systems, defense electronics, machine tools, the organic industrial base, and workforce training. The memorandum emphasizes that a robust domestic industrial base is crucial for national security and critical infrastructure preservation.
